alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Misty Fjords; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 31 at 6:38AM AKST until February 02 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Alaska including Juneau, Yakutat, Elfin Cove, Pelican, Gustavus, Hoonah, Angoon, Petersburg, Wrangell, Kake, and Hyder. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Travel may be difficult at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A significant winter storm is expected to impact Southeast Alaska Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday night. A transition to rain is expected on Wednesday starting along the Outer Coast first then moving north and east through the day. Lower confidence exists in the timing of the change over to rain. Areas that remain snow longer may receive higher snow totals. Heavy precipitation is expected to persist Thursday through the weekend with heavy rain likely at sea level and heavy snow for the Haines and Klondike Highways.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
